pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1970–71)

rows.text: Pilot of F-4D #66‑8784 hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Radar intercept officer on F-4B #152281 hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #152281 hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0357 that crashed during a low-level training flight, the weapons system operator 1LT Campbell survived
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of HH-53B #66-14434 Jolly Green 71, shot down on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pararescueman on HH-53B #66-14434 Jolly Green 71, shot down on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Flight engineer on HH-53B #66-14434 Jolly Green 71, shot down on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pararescueman on HH-53B #66-14434 Jolly Green 71, shot down on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of UH-1H #68-16441 that crashed on a flight from Hue to Phu Bai. He was severely injured in the crash and the entire crew was captured by enemy forces. He was killed by one of the guards and buried near the crash site. The remaining crew members Capt. John W. Parsels, SP5 Tom Y. Kobashigawa and SP4 Daniel Hefel were released in 1973
Died in captivity, remains not returned
His A-7B #154391crashed into the sea on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #151454 that crashed at sea offshore of Quang Tri Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar intercept operator on F-4B #151454 that crashed at sea offshore of Quang Tri Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7526 shot down on a bombing mission. The weapons system operator Capt Robert S Dotson ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Fell from a hoist while being lowered to search for 2LT David Skibbe
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-7A #153136 crashed into the sea immediately after launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of CH-46D #154808 that crashed at sea offshore of Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0282 hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0282 hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar intercept officer on F-4J #155775that disappeared on an air combat patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4J #155775 that disappeared on an air combat patrol
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Adviser assigned to the ARVN 2nd Regiment, disappeared when the ARVN position at the Khe Gio Bridge was overrrun by enemy forces

Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑8696 shot down on a FAC mission, both crewmen ejected successfully and he radioed for ordinance to be dropped on his position as he was surrounded by enemy forces. The pilot Capt Richard Rash was rescued
Killed while on patrol, his body could not be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Gunner on UH-1E #152427 shot down on a covert Prairie Fire insertion mission. The pilot 1LT Larry Parsons survived and was rescued 19 days later, while the copilot 1LT Robert Castle was killed and his remains were recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crew chief on UH-1E #152427 shot down on a covert insertion mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-1G that disappeared on a familiarisation flight. The remains of the copilot Maj. Richard G. Elzinga were identified in July 2011
Killed in action, his body disappeared on its way to graves registration
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar Intercept Officer on F-4B #152325 that caught fire and crashed while returining from a combat air patrol mission, both crewmen ejected successfully but he drowned before SAR forces could arrive
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed during an ambush his body could not be receovered as his team evaded the enemy
Killed in action, body not recovered
Photojournalist captured while motorcycling down Highway One, believed to have been executed by the Khmer Rouge in 1971
His F-100D #56-3278 failed to pull up from a strafing run, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on E-2A that had a fire onboard after launch and crashed at sea while trying to return to the carrier
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of E-2A that had a fire onboard after launch and crashed at sea while trying to return to the carrier
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of E-2A that had a fire onboard after launch and crashed at sea while trying to return to the carrier
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4E #152099 crashed due to enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pathfinder for the insertion of an ARVN unit, he was severely wounded in battle and captured. He is reported to have later died of his wounds
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #66‑0409 shot down on a reconnaissance mission
Pilot of RF-4C #66‑0409 shot down on a reconnaissance mission

Pilot of OV-10 shot down on an armed reconnaissance mission, both crewmen ejected successfully. The copilot Capt Charles Hatch was rescued the following day but Maj Wheeler reported he was surrounded by enemy forces and it is believed that he was killed resisting capture
His A-4C Skyhawk #148484 crashed into ground on a night bombing run
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of AH-1G #67-15612 that crashed while supporting an emergency night extraction mission
Aircraft commander of AH-1G #67-15612 that crashed while supporting an emergency night extraction mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7639 that crashed on an armed reconnaissance mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑7639 that crashed on an armed reconnaissance mission
Shot and killed while leading a MIKE Force patrol, his body could not be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of UH-1H #66-17626 that crashed at sea offshore of Quang Nam Province during a medevac mission. All four crewmen evacuated the helicopter but only the copilot WO Donald Study was rescued, the bodies of two other crewmen were recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared during an enemy night attack of Fire Support Base Granite
Passenger on UH-1H #68-16512 hit by ground fire and crashed, he disappeared while evading capture
Passenger on UH-1H #68-16512 hit by ground fire and crashed, he disappeared while evading capture
Passenger on UH-1H #68-16512 hit by ground fire and crashed, he was believed to have been captured
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑7613 hit by enemy fire and crashed in a river
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7613 hit by enemy fire and crashed in a river
Killed in action, body not recovered

Gunner on UH-1H #68-15663 that collided with another helicopter and crashed while laying a smoke screen. The bodies of the copilot WO1 Robert L. Kirk and crew chief Specialist 4 William C. Weiss were recovered later that day
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #68-15663 that collided with another helicopter and crashed.
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on UH-1C #66-15148 which crashed and exploded, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4D #65‑0607hit by enemy fire and crashed on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Pilot of F-4D #65‑0607hit by enemy fire and crashed on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Crewman on EKA-3B #142657 that disappeared en route from Naval Air Station Cubi Point to Da Nang Air Base. The body of the navigator LCDR Eugene F. McNally was recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of EKA-3B #142657 that disappeared en route from Naval Air Station Cubi Point to Da Nang Air Base
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #152239 that crashed shortly after launch, the radar intercept officer Lt. Kane ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered

Crew chief on CH-46A #153403 that was hit by enemy fire and crashed on a narrow hillside landing zone while extracting a MACV-SOG team, his body was trapped under the wreckage and could not be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of F-4B #151478, hit by ground fire. The radar intercept officer 1LT W Peper initiated ejection, and both crewmen ejected but he was seen to be limp in his parachute. 1LT Paper was rescued by SAR forces
Killed in action, body not recovered
Detachment B-2, C Company, 5th Special Forces Group
Observer on O-1F #57-2890 that disappeared on a visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of O-1F #57-2890 that disappeared on a visual reconnaissance mission
Drowned while returning from a night ambush position
Killed in action, body not recovered
Team leader killed in an ambush while on a reconnaissance mission
Member of a ranger team killed in an ambush while on a reconnaissance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0297 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0297 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed while on patrol, his body was unable to be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4C crashed into the sea after a night launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by an explosive device while on patrol, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared when the truck he was riding in was ambushed on Ben Cat - Provincial Highway 7B. He is believed to have been captured and died in captivity
Disappeared when the truck he was riding in was ambushed on Ben Cat - Provincial Highway 7B. He is believed to have been captured and died in captivity
Disappeared when the truck he was riding in was ambushed on Ben Cat - Provincial Highway 7B. He is believed to have been captured and died in captivity
His A-7A #153176 was shot down on a night bombing run
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0279 that disappeared on a bombing mission
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0279 that disappeared on a bombing mission
Crew chief on UH-1D #66-16693 hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned, no recoverable remains. The door gunner PFC J Goosman was the only survivor
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of OV-10A #68-3807 hit by enemy fire on a visual reconnaissance mission, he was apparently wounded and failed to eject. The observer SFC Albert E. Mosiello ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Battle of Fire Support Base Ripcord
Disappeared during a night attack on his lookout position
Killed when his reconnaissance patrol was ambushed, his boy could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Battle of Fire Support Base Ripcord
Assistant machine-gunner, shot and killed during an ambush on his patrol, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Battle of Fire Support Base Ripcord
Rifleman shot and killed during an ambush on his patrol, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Battle of Fire Support Base Ripcord
Medic who fell from the skid of a medevac helicopter from a height of 400ft while deserting his unit
Pilot of F-4D hit by enemy fire on a strafing run and crashed, no ejection observed. The remains of the weapons system operator 1Lt. Donald B. Bloodworth were identified in 1998
Pilot of F-4J #155789 that suffered control problems. The radar intercept officer LTJG W Harding ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #66‑0436 lost on a night reconnaissance mission
Pilot of RF-4C #66‑0436 lost on a night reconnaissance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #69-15375 shot down while extracting a reconnaissance team, he was killed in the crash and his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #69-15375 shot down while extracting a reconnaissance team, he died from injuries shortly after the crash and his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0312 that collided with another F-4E #67‑0257 during a night strike mission. The other 3 crewmen were all killed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-2A that disappeared during a forward air control mission
His A-4E #151165 was shot down on a night air support mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
RT Fer de Lance, CCN, MACV-SOG
Team leader wounded during an ambush on his patrol, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
RT Fer de Lance, CCN, MACV-SOG
Assistant team leader wounded during an ambush on his patrol, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of RF-4C #68‑0610 that disappeared while returning from a photo reconnaissance mission
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #68‑0610 that disappeared while returning from a photo reconnaissance mission
His F-8J #150289 crashed into the rear of the carrier while making a night-landing
Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer on OH-6A #67-16193 hit by enemy fire and crashed snf burned on a reconnaissance mission. SAR forces recovered the bodies of the two other crewmen the following day
Team leader of a reconnaissance patrol overrun by enemy forces
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

C Company, Troop Command, Army Depot Cam Ranh Bay
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on RF-4C #66‑0420that crashed while making a low-level reconnaissance pass
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of RF-4C #66‑0420 that crashed while making a low-level reconnaissance pass
Killed in action, body not recovered
The landing gear on his RF-8G #145624 collapsed during launch, he ejected but drowned before SAR forces could arrive
Killed in action, body not recovered

Observer on OH-6A #67-16484 wounded when the helicopter was hit by enemy fire on an armed reconnaissance mission. The pilot made an emergency landing and the helicopter caught fire, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when his long range reconnaissance patrol was ambushed, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Drowned during a river crossing on patrol
Killed when his long range reconnaissance patrol was ambushed, his body could not be recovered due to strong enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #69-15184 that crashed into Danang Harbour
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-2A #67-21428 that crashed on an evening forward air control mission
Observer on O-2A #67-21428 that crashed on an evening forward air control mission
Passenger on C-2A #152793 that crashed shortly after launch from USS Ranger (CV-61) on a flight to Cubi Point
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of C-2A #152793 that crashed shortly after launch from USS Ranger (CV-61)
Killed in action, body not recovered
Flight engineer on C-2A #152793 that crashed shortly after launch from USS Ranger (CV-61)
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of C-2A #152793 that crashed shortly after launch from USS Ranger (CV-61)
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Aircraft commander of U-1A #55-3298 that broke up in mid-air on a courier flight offshore of Phu Yen Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of U-1A #55-3298 that broke up in mid-air on a courier flight offshore of Phu Yen Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
His O-1 was shot down and crashed, he escaped from the crashed aircraft but was mortally wounded while evading the enemy
Killed in action, body not recovered
